channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Japan’s Leader Won’t Enter the Male-Dominated Sumo Ring
item.description: Sanae Takaichi, the first woman to lead Japan as prime minister, skipped a sumo awards ceremony, reflecting her cautious approach to gender issues.

item.title: ‘The Bermuda Triangle of Talent’: 27-year-old Oxford grad turned down McKinsey and Morgan Stanley to find out why Gen Z’s smartest keep selling out
item.description: Simon van Teutem talked to Fortune about “the illusion of infinite choice, and the social status … You’re always looking for the next level, the Harva...

item.title: Xi’s Purge of China’s Military Brings Its Top General Down
item.description: The ouster of Gen. Zhang Youxia, who was second only to Xi Jinping in the military hierarchy, marks “the total annihilation of the high command,” one ...

item.title: Morris Katz Is 26 and Ready to Fix the Democrats’ Strategy
item.description: Part casting director, part media guru, Morris Katz is behind the biggest Democratic campaigns this cycle.

item.title: Silicon Valley talent keeps getting recycled, so this CEO uses a ‘moneyball’ approach for uncovering hidden AI geniuses in the new era
item.description: HelloSky takes a different approach to recruiting top tech candidates.

item.title: New York City Schools Announce Remote Learning Day in Response to Storm
item.description: With as much as a foot of snow expected to fall across the city, schools will be closed on Monday, Mayor Zohran Mamdani said.

item.title: Videos show man killed by immigration agents was only holding a phone before he was shot, contradicting administration statements
item.description: In a video obtained by AP, Pretti is standing in the street and holding up his phone. He is face-to-face with an officer in a tactical vest, who place...

item.title: A quarter of employed adults use AI at least a few times a week, with 6 in 10 tech workers using it frequently, Gallup says
item.description: Some 12% of employed adults say they use AI daily in their job, according to a Gallup Workforce survey conducted this fall of more than 22,000 U.S. wo...

item.title: Massive winter storm leaves 800,000 without power so far as Trump declares emergencies in at least a dozen states
item.description: “Behind the storm it’s just going to get bitterly cold across basically the entirety of the eastern two-thirds of the nation, east of the Rockies."

item.title: The Woman Who Stands Between Donald Trump and Greenland
item.description: Mette Frederiksen, Denmark’s leader, has taken big risks standing up to Mr. Trump. It might just be working — for now.

item.title: The Podcaster Poking at France’s Biggest Secrets
item.description: Philippe Collin makes intricate series that are reshaping how French people understand uncomfortable parts of their history. Millions are tuning in.

item.title: In Venezuela, Families Search for Relatives Who Are Detained and Missing
item.description: Even as dozens of political prisoners have been freed, at least 66 people taken by state authorities and never heard from again remain missing, relati...
